body_html: In regards to what @ebrevdo said, I think the solution is not to fix the legacy seq2seq code, but to update the tutorial to use the contrib.seq2seq package instead, which is actively maintained. It is quite demoralizing when the first tensorflow program you ever run spits out a bunch of errors. If I have some time this week, I'll submit a PR.

body: In regards to what @ebrevdo said, I think the solution is not to fix the legacy seq2seq code, but to update the tutorial to use the `contrib.seq2seq` package instead, which is actively maintained.  It is quite demoralizing when the first tensorflow program you ever run spits out a bunch of errors.  If I have some time this week, I'll submit a PR.
